remarks: There exist infinitely many prime numbers: the set of all primes ` S ` is unbounded by ~ infpn , so by ~ unben it is infinite.  This is Metamath 100 proof #11.  (Contributed by NM, 5-May-2005.)
statement:
infpn2.1 $e |- S = { n e. NN | ( 1 < n /\ A. m e. NN ( ( n / m ) e. NN -> ( m = 1 \/ m = n ) ) ) } $.
infpn2 $p |- S ~~ NN $.
$d m n $.
